intro: Kayea grandis, commonly known as the Hawaiian kahili, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its striking red bracts that surround its small white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a waxy texture. Kayea grandis is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii and is often found in coastal and lowland areas.
